description: An excellent cactus for growing indoors on a windowsill or patio. It grows quickly for up to 12 inches. The blue pigment gets brighter as it olds!
A desert dweller that grows in gravel soil. Claret cup hedgehog cactus is a desert beaut for warm, arid climate gardeners.
A specimen which grows rounded, much like a barrel, up to 3 ft. tall and around. Although enticing, be wary of its stiff yellow needles as they may prick.
An essential to any culinary herb garden for its many uses in varied cuisines. It is easy to grow, ideal for the cook/gardener in you!
Whether you want to extract your own healthy sugar or add sweet herbalness to your tea, stevia will offer it to you with its sweet leaves!
Plant care requires well-draining soil, hefty dose of watering, and protection from wind or frost. In 4 to 8 months, it will bear fruits for your hardwork.
It is an alpine plant, meaning it has great tolerance with poor soils and unwelcoming conditions. It is not only pleasant to the eyes, but also comes with little commitment!
The bright touch it adds to indoors comes from its neediness of sunlight. They are best placed in sunny rooms or warm outdoors.
It is known for its signature dark-green and white zebra-striping. It is fairly easy to grow and propagate if given regular dose of water and care.
